comment: Took Bio 1107 Lab, no option on here. Very nice teacher but talks a lot and rambles. She was very helpful when we got stuck, but would not explain the labs very well. Has a lot of medical knowledge as she was a practicing doctor, which is fun to talk about after class, but seeps a lot into class.
Super egotistical, never admits when she is at fault and will penalize the class when she is at fault. And holy she is a yapper about stuff that has absolutely nothing to do with class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is a very nice professor, however, she could have done more with the lectures because she would read directly off the PowerPoint slides. Attendance was not mandatory, but there were assignments people missed because she would hand them out randomly. She is not very d2L experienced so there were constant issues with assignments not opening.

I felt very lucky to have her as my bio professor, lots of extensions, and she responds very quick to emails. I can't say I learned much but she makes this course very easy and she understands you have other classes that are important. She even allowed us group project instead of a final exam. She tends to go off subject a lot but overall very nice

Her lectures put you to sleep. By the end of the semester, there was like a 20% attendance rate bc her class was so easy to do online and honestly probably just less of a hassle to do online. I didn't show up after Halloween. Tests and quizzes are easy, but there's a quiz like every week and a test every 2 weeks. Not terrible, but not great either.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance was not mandatory, but if you missed a class you probably just missed a 50 point assignment that you cannot makeup. She does not have a clear schedule on when something is due, so it is really important to go to class. She is a nice professor, but not lenient when it comes to a missed assignment that won't even be on the syllabus.

Responds quickly to emails for the most part. Struggles to use D2L sometimes and will have items locked that we need to see. Her study guides don't help at all and I didn't find her lectures to help much either. Quizlet will be your friend. Extra credit stuff to help you pass though which is nice. She grades discussions way too harshly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Took her a year ago so I might forget some stuff. Our final was extra credit so I ended up getting a 100 on my transcript. Homework was a little difficult (i had a 85 average) but participation and quiz will make up for it. Be sure to ask questions and you should get an easy A with the extra credit final
She genuinely wants you to have a good career after her class. I plan on going to nursing school and hope to be accepted soon. She helped me realize my potential AND she gave me real life advice.
I loved this professor. As long as you do your work it is a super easy lab. She gets off-topic a lot but it's honestly really funny and doesn't affect anything. Take her if you can.
Great Teacher! Very very easy. She actually cares about her students. Please take her!
She is very strict with lockdown browser however she is very understanding. She gives many opportunities for extra credit.

Dont take her if you actually want to learn. Go for it if you need an easy A. Stay on top of assignments as they will pop up randomly and dates may even change. She cant teach and obviously doesnt know the material she just reads slides still going 15 minutes after class is over! Go to class though or you could miss important info

EASY CLASS, horrible professor she just reads slides word for word and expects you to understand and goes over the time allotted for class! most things can be googled tho so easy A. LOOK FOR YOUR ASSIGNMENTS on d2l and mastering! expect the unexpected! check everyday! Participation is a grade, theres extra credit and she thinks shes never wrong!

An easy A if you do the work, just stay on top of due dates. Exams aren't too hard and very fair. Drops some grades and gives plenty of extra credit and time to makeup assignments. Group projects weren't very beneficial but easy grades. Would definitely take again, I couldn't recommend her more.

Dr. C is awesome! She cares about her students actually learning, not just memorizing. She provides very useful resources. All of her exams are cumulative which helps a lot in preparation for the final. She is fair & helpful. Lots of opportunity to improve grade. Mastering assignments, 6 Exams, 7 Quizzes, Final Exam & a couple other assignments.

Beware before you take this class. Professor does not inform you on upcoming assignments or test/quizzes. There is a separate website to do the homework which is confusing if its your first time using Pearson, there are a lot of assignments in this course and easy to fall behind. Need to have good time management skills.
